en.purpose: To calculate and interpret the total sum for the Berg Balance Scale.
en.use: Berg Balance Scale evaluates both dynamic and static balance through 14 mobility-related tasks. Each task is graded on a 5-point ordinal scale that ranges from 0 to 4 for a maximum score of 56.

other_details.references:
Bogle Thorbahn LD, Newton RA. Use of the Berg Balance Test to predict falls in elderly persons. Phys Ther. 1996 Jun;76(6):576-83; discussion 584-5. doi: 10.1093/ptj/76.6.576. PMID: 8650273.

Berg KO, Wood-Dauphinee SL, Williams JI, Maki B. Measuring balance in the elderly: validation of an instrument. Can J Public Health. 1992 Jul-Aug;83 Suppl 2:S7-11. PMID: 1468055.

Miranda N, Tiu TK. Berg Balance Testing. 2023 Feb 17. In: StatPearls [Internet]. Treasure Island (FL): StatPearls Publishing; 2025 Jan–. PMID: 34662032.
other_details.en: The Berg Balance Scale is a test used to assess functional balance. It can be used to assess patients with stroke or various neurological conditions, such as Parkinson’s disease, multiple sclerosis, traumatic brain injury, as well as acquired conditions like lower extremity amputation.
